title: Emigre
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150205001225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Foundries](http://web.archive.org/web/20150205001225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Foundries) : Emigre**

Historians of the future might regard Emigre as pioneers into digital typography. Common knowledge puts Emigre, led by wife and husband duo [Zuzana Licko](http://web.archive.org/web/20150205001225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Zuzana%20Licko) and [Rudy Vanderlans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150205001225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rudy%20Vanderlans) at the forefront of the digital foundry era. The foundry got its start in 1984 when Zuzana designed a series of bitmap fonts for the new Macintosh from [Apple Computer](http://web.archive.org/web/20150205001225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Apple%20Computer). For nearly two decades Emigre put out [Emigre Magazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150205001225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Emigre%20Magazine), a monthly publication of the same name, with thoughtful essays and articles aimed to stir up dialogue and of course drive sales of their typefaces.

Website: [http://www.emigre.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150205001225/http:/www.emigre.com/ "http://www.emigre.com")
author: Conor
